meanings.definition: The art or process of creating realistic models or replicas of body parts for medical training or display.
meanings.sent1: The hospital used moulage to teach students about human anatomy.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a moulage of a human heart for visitors to see.
meanings.sent3: During the medical training, the moulage of a hand made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her moulage of a foot was so lifelike, it seemed ready to step out of the display.
meanings.sent5: The moulage of the brain was so detailed that it looked real at first glance.

meanings.definition: A mold or cast made from a living subject for medical or artistic purposes.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a moulage of her friend's face for a sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The doctor used a moulage of the patient's hand to study the injury.
meanings.sent3: The moulage of the tree bark was mistaken for the real thing by a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: His moulage of the seashell captured every detail, like a frozen moment in time.
meanings.sent5: The moulage of the flower petal was so delicate, it looked like it could flutter away.
